meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the unit of electric charge, the coulomb.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted a coulombic experiment to measure the electric charge.
meanings.sent2: The coulombic properties of the material determined its conductivity.
meanings.sent3: The coulombic cupcakes in the lab were charged with extra sweetness.
meanings.sent4: The coulombic relationship between the particles was electrifying.
meanings.sent5: The students were amazed by the coulombic effect on the magnets.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the force between electric charges.
meanings.sent1: The coulombic attraction between the positive and negative charges was strong.
meanings.sent2: The coulombic force between the electrons caused the spark.
meanings.sent3: The coulombic rivalry between the protons and electrons was shocking.
meanings.sent4: The coulombic tension in the air was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The coulombic interaction between the charges was like a dance of electricity.
